creator: ken_ww@yahoo.com
text:
System version: MacOS X 10.3.9
I don't know how to tell what http server version is running, so I'm guessing here.

No recent upgrades done to system.
On restart, the http server sends only the test page included with MacOS X 10.3.9, in spite of the fact that the httpd.config file has virtualhosts switched on and has a number of virtualhosts defined. Those sites were being served correctly until this occurred.

The following sites are served by this server:

http://www.whitmore-family.net
http://www.alaska43.org
http://www.kingkrill.com
https://secure.whitmore-family.net
https://secure.kingkrill.com

This is a major problem for the business sites and for the other sites as well.

This sounds like a Mac OS X specific configuration error and should be fixed downstream.

Furthermore did you report this against Apache HTTP Server 1.3.x which is not supported anymore and no bugs will be fixed in the old codebase (cf. <http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-announce/201002.mbox/%3C20100203000334.GA19021@infiltrator.stdlib.net%3E>).

Thank you for reporting the bug.
creator: mss@apache.org
